name: padijun
text: This sums up perfectly what happens when your retarded friends find rotten.com

name: paco
text: A comment left by paco was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, NeoNaoNeo, Bananacup, apres)

name: bozendoka
text: Or bumper stickers on Facebook.

name: gamemeister27
text: Now I can't stop looking, damn you!

name: catachresis
text: Close Microsoft Word, Ray. Nothing is happening here.

name: cailetshadow
text: Don't discourage him! This could be the world's finest piece of Helicopter Death fanfiction.

name: farqussus
text: Nothing can beat the Dickensian detail of Sauron_21's "Man who got sucked through the turbine of an F-14"

name: pan-optic
text: I feel like there's not a lot to say about such an event. My grasp on the physics of such an event, of course, is not the mightiest, but the impression received is that that sort of thing would not leave a lot behind that had a consistency more solid than, say, air freshener.

name: homeskool
text:
If I were to write such a thing, it would start much like this:

In the cool early morning sea breeze, I awoke to the sun peeking happily through my window. I donned my uniform and made my way out the deck, where the arrival and departure of jet powered aircraft was a common occurrence. This particular day, however, I was to have an unfortunate inquest with a rather foul-tempered F-14 and his posse, the Twin Turbine Opium Engine Twins. I cannot quite explain exactly how events transpired to contribute to my untimely demise, but I can expound upon how I came to enter and exit promptly through this marvel of -- *whircrunchCRASH* "OH HEAVENS" *whirhummmcrunchbzzzzzzz*

name: invidious
text:
And yet, believe it or not, the dude survived.

Luckily, the plane had just been shut off and the engines were spooling down. They still had just enough suction to draw the poor flight deck sap into the turbine, and his body absorbed most of the rest of it.

Had they been going full-speed, your comment would certainly be horrifyingly accurate.

name: dersquirrel
text: Sauron_21 really jumped the shark with the Dragonball Z crossover in the sequel, though.

name: tekende
text: Were I to compile a list of my top five favorite Assetbar comments, this comment would be on it.

name: d-pad
text: This is Ray. Something is always happening.

name: billyamericana
text: You never can tell someone about something cool without them getting all Jack Palance if they're reading, even if it is just the latest People magazine.

name: gsail11
text:
Man beef don't read no people magazine

give the guy a little better than that

name: geysershitdick
text: does this picture exist

name: skiddyfisk
text: yes it does but i am not going to go look for it

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
i have seen this image. it's actually a series of images. it is just as ray describes it. if anyone's particularly interested, i'll try to track it down again - but i don't recommend being particularly interested.

it makes you feel not unlike this.

name: joeyramoney
text: here we go.

name: geysershitdick
text:
I'm scared to click it.

I don't think I'm gonna.

name: buttermoths
text: 404. Thank God.

name: salvagebar
text: It was only 404'd because he added an extra slash at the end. This links to a page that indexes the images, but doesn't have the images themselves, so you get one chance to turn back.

name: saint
text:
Thank God for that buffer.

I was this close.

name: senseihollywood
text: I've seen it too...Rotten.com is full of things I wish I could un-see...

name: rowboat
text: If only there was some way to....I don't know.... not go there!

name: bucklemyshoe
text: Who says he plans to go back?  He said un-see, not un-plan-to-see

name: rowboat
text: OK.

name: anzio
text:
Wanna know what I wish I could un-see? "Three Guys, One Hammer". Awh man... it's like... it's like it's worse than anything on Rotten.com, and it's worse than Two Girls, One Cup, but it's not as bad as One Guy, One Jar, or that one with the guy and the horse...

But yeah, to spoil the video for you (Unless you really want to watch it, in which I implore that you take caution, as it is considered 'bad for the soul' by many), these two Ukrainian guys kill a guy with a hammer and a screwdriver and film it, and you see the human body do things that are pretty fucking terrible. I watched it, and I will never be the same again.

name: jackaction
text: Did you seriously just say that you thought a man getting his face smashed in with a hammer and his stomach shanked with a screwdriver wasn't as bad as a guy shoving a jar up his arse?

name: anzio
text: I did, though I retract it upon further examination. I'm not sure what I was thinking at the time. Perhaps it did not quite hit me that a man dieing by hammer is much worse then a man shoving a jar into himself.

name: tristanhw
text: The blade clearly wasn't "sharp as HELL" then.

name: red_dawn
text: Holy shit! The USS Demeter is a real boat (but is a battle damage repair ship rather then a carrier.)

name: chrissketch
text: I love the baffled look on Ray's face in panel 4. Its saying, "Why would my very good friend, Roast Beef, not want to look at this picture of a guy who got killed by a helicopter?"

name: mjfitzge
text: i think that's just the uneasy look one gets when seeing someone else's brains everywhere.

name: cailetshadow
text:
Beef's thought process..Revealed!
Panel 2: huh.
Panel 3: Nope.

name: tagrineth
text: Beef's eye roll is panel 10 is truly epic.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: it does not happen anywhere else.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Weekend Blogs (Saturday - Monday)

Roast Beef: Got the lamp!
Lyle: 'sfer shit
Molly: The Achewood A-List!...for January 10, 2006.
Nice Pete: You may ask where I am.

name: drago25
text: Dude I wanted to see where this was going

name: firesign
text: I don't fear lames for this since we're on a forum for a comic strip full of good writing, 3 dimensional characters, and good dialogue: regarding the alt text, I have to say that even Ray's writing skills are worlds better than Dan Brown's...

name: straw
text: See, you explained why you don't fear lames for this comment, and indeed you likely will receive none.  The Venn diagram of Achewood readers and Dan Brown readers looks like an 8.

name: ford
text: Goddamn Dan Brown for taking several hours of my life with his shitty book.

name: stereo
text: It was pretty much a bonding experience for me.  We reveled in how wrong he could be in so many ways, and then poked fun at the diction for extra credit.

name: boredom_man
text: My son made me read it when it came out. He's 14 now, and deeply embarrassed by this.

name: philophobe
text: Chubby for completely accurate Venn diagram remark.

name: mcnubbins
text: This exact thing happened to me tonight. I still have the text document open. Wait, why am I tell you this.

name: mcnubbins
text: Give me the benefit of the doubt and chalk this typo-orthographical error up to an ESL thing. That's the reason I can't spell.

name: spicyponyhead
text: VLAD?!

name: kieranthomson
text: C'mon Ray. There are no Colonels in the Navy. Seriously dawg.

name: rowboat
text: So there we are walkin' down Nine Mile, approachin' the wreck, and we spot a spherical object restin' in the highway. And it AIN'T a part of the car.

name: dasilodavi
text: The cat tells his friend about a death photo so badly that his friend  leaves him.

name: cagliostro
text: Apart from the whole helicopter death aspect, does anyone else get a faint Wallace & Gromit vibe off this one? I think it's Beef's expressions...

name: fattypneumonia
text: Lil' bit, lil' bit....

name: smallberries
text: The most irritating event that regularly occurs in my daily life is exactly this: being queried from another room to look at something I have zero interest in. I despise YouTube. And memes. Except for Achewood memes.
